alert.note: Alert for Sandusky; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:06PM EST until February 19 at 11:18AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. Blanchard River Near Findlay affecting Hancock County. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandusky River...including Tiffin...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blanchard River...including Findlay...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Portage River At Woodville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Water is encroaching on State Route 105 in Sandusky County northeast of U.S. 23. Water is in the backyard of residents on Bierley, Bridge, and Water Streets in Pemberville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 10.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 03/14/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM EST.
